meta_data.title: Research Paper Guidelines and Structures
meta_data.abstract: This document provides guidelines on structuring research papers, exploring aspects such as acknowledgments, appendices, multi-language presentation, and SIGCHI Extended Abstracts. It emphasizes consistency and ease of extraction in the article metadata process.

relate work.related papers: Studies on how to effectively communicate scientific ideas in document formats and the implications of structured documents.

high_level_summary.summary of this paper: The paper elaborates on various structural elements of a research paper, emphasizing their significance for coherence and ease of interpretation. It focuses on the technical setup of document structures such as acknowledgments and appendices.
high_level_summary.research purpose: To provide researchers a comprehensive guide on structuring their research papers for better organization and standardization.

Method.description: This paper outlines the methods and structures commonly used in research papers to streamline the process of writing and ensure consistent formatting.
Method.model: Document formatting using LaTeX for structured sections in research papers.

Experiments.results: Explained various structural sections of research papers with examples.

conclusion.summary: This guideline aims to aid researchers in understanding and implementing structured formatting for various components of their research papers, promoting consistency and enhancing readability.
conclusion.future work: Future editions of this guideline plan to include examples across different domains and specific use-cases for new formatting challenges.
